H0.text: What is the darkly common name for the plague which killed 30-50% of Europe between 1347-52. The Great Pestilence

H1.text: What is the darkly common name for the plague which killed 30-50% of Europe between 1347-52. The Dark Scourge

H2.text: What is the darkly common name for the plague which killed 30-50% of Europe between 1347-52. The European Calamity

H3.text: What is the darkly common name for the plague which killed 30-50% of Europe between 1347-52. Blackdeath

A4.text: the event was called the 'great pestilence'.

A5.text: The 1347 pandemic plague was not referred to specifically as 'black', at the time, in any European language.
